title: 107_s2854
content: The "Medicare Safety Net Hospital Improvement Act of 2002" allows for the collection of data and modification of Medicare payments to hospitals serving vulnerable populations. The "Medicare Safety Net Hospital Improvement Act of 2002" allows the Secretary to collect annual data on inpatient and outpatient charges from subsection (d) hospitals for various patient categories. The "Medicare Safety Net Hospital Improvement Act of 2002" authorizes the Secretary to gather yearly data on inpatient and outpatient charges from subsection (d) hospitals for different patient categories. This includes programs funded by State or local governments with charity care charges and bad debt considerations. Additional payments are provided for hospitals serving a significant number of low-income patients. The Medicare Safety Net Hospital Improvement Act of 2002 allows for additional payments to hospitals based on the disproportionate share adjustment percentage, which is calculated using the hospital's disproportionate patient percentage, threshold percentage, and a conversion factor. The Medicare Safety Net Hospital Improvement Act of 2002 establishes a conversion factor for additional payments to hospitals based on the disproportionate share adjustment percentage. The Secretary establishes the conversion factor for additional hospital payments based on data collected. Hospitals serving a significantly disproportionate number of low-income patients qualify for extra payments. The Safety Net Hospital Improvement Act of 2002 allows for additional payments to hospitals with a high disproportionate patient percentage. The Secretary determines the threshold percentage based on collected data. Section 1886(b)(3)(G)(ii)(II) of the Social Security Act is amended to adjust the threshold percentage for qualified long-term care hospitals. The Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Benefits Improvement and Protection Act of 2000 is amended to adjust certain percentages and clauses. The Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Benefits Improvement and Protection Act of 2000 is amended to adjust certain percentages and clauses related to disproportionate share adjustment percentages. The Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Benefits Improvement and Protection Act of 2000 is amended to adjust disproportionate share adjustment percentages for hospitals starting from April 1, 2004. The adjustment percentage must ensure that the number of hospitals qualifying for this adjustment remains the same or increases compared to the previous period. The Medicare Safety Net Hospital Improvement Act of 2002 made technical amendments to the Social Security Act.
